abstract_summ: A configuration model for epidemic spread, based on a scale-free network, is introduced.There are various diffusion models for S shaped processes like virus diffusion and these models are typically not nested.We discuss an approach for fitting robust nonlinear regression models, which can be employed to model and predict the contagion dynamics of the Covid-19 in Italy.We present an elementary model of COVID-19 propagation that makes explicit the connection between testing strategies and rates of transmission and the linear growth in new cases observed in many parts of the world.To model the evolution of diseases with extended latency periods and the presence of asymptomatic patients like COVID-19, we define a simple discrete time stochastic SIR-type epidemic model.
title_summ: COVID-19 spreading: a modelAn Age and Space Structured SIR Model Describing the Covid-19 PandemicA Bayesian Logistic Growth Model for the Spread of COVID-19 in New YorkForecasting virus diffusion with simple Bayesian forecast combinationOn Linear Growth in COVID-19 CasesWhen will the Covid-19 epidemic fade out?Management strategies and prediction of COVID-19 by a fractional order generalized SEIR modelA poor-man's approach to the effective reproduction number: the COVID-19 caseA COVID-19 epidemic model integrating direct and fomite transmission as well as household structureTime delay epidemic model for COVID-19A phenomenological algorithm for short-range predictions of the Covid-19 pandemics 2020Simple Mathematics on Covid-19 ExpansionA reproduction rate which perfectly fits Covid-19A matlab code to compute reproduction numbers with applications to the Covid-19 outbreakA stochastic epidemic model of COVID-19 diseaseIn Response to COVID-19: Configuration Model of the Epidemic SpreadingRobust inference for nonlinear regression models from the Tsallis score: application to Covid-19 contagion in ItalyA multi-region variant of the SIR model and its extensionsModeling strict age-targeted mitigation strategies for COVID-19Time-Varying COVID-19 Reproduction Number in the United StatesPolicy Implications of an Approximate Linear Infection Model for SARS-CoV-2A simple model for COVID-19CoViD-19 epidemic follows the "kinetics" of enzymes with cooperative substrate binding.
title_abstract_phrases: In Response to COVID-19: Configuration Model of the Epidemic SpreadingA configuration model for epidemic spread, based on a scale-free network, is introduced.A poor-man's approach to the effective reproduction number: the COVID-19 caseIt is shown that estimates of the effective reproduction number Rt for COVID-19 using standard packages such as EPIESTIM can be reproduced very accurately using the expression Rt = c(t) /c(t + τ) , where c(t) is the incidence at time t and τ the mean value of the series intervalA COVID-19 epidemic model integrating direct and fomite transmission as well as household structureThis paper stresses its base contribution on a new SIR-type model for COVID-19 including direct and fomite transmission as well as the effect of distinct household structures.To what extent increasing the physical-distancing-related contact radius and enhancing mass control (public curfew, lockdown, workplace clearance, and school closure) reduce the number of predicted active cases is studied via parameter estimation.When will the Covid-19 epidemic fade out?A discrete-time deterministic epidemic model is proposed with the aim of reproducing the behaviour observed in the incidence of real infectious diseases.Robust inference for nonlinear regression models from the Tsallis score: application to Covid-19 contagion in ItalyWe discuss an approach for fitting robust nonlinear regression models, which can be employed to model and predict the contagion dynamics of the Covid-19 in Italy.
